segments.text: That was a rouser, wasn't it?
segments.speaker: M

segments.text: That was the first time you ever hit me.

segments.text: I didn't hit you very hard.

segments.text: The manager came in and found us rolling about on the floor, biting and scratching like panthers.  Oh, dear.

segments.text: I shall never forget his face.
segments.speaker: M

segments.text: How ridiculous.  How utterly, utterly ridiculous.
segments.speaker: F

segments.text: We were very much younger then.
segments.speaker: M

segments.text: And very much sillier.
segments.speaker: F

segments.text: As a matter of fact, the real cause of that row was Peter Burden.
segments.speaker: M

segments.text: You knew there was nothing in that.
segments.speaker: F

segments.text: I knew nothing of the sort.  You took presents from him.
segments.speaker: M

segments.text: Presents?  A trivial little brooch.
segments.speaker: F

segments.text: I remember it well, bristling with diamonds in the worst possible taste.
segments.speaker: M

segments.text: Not at all.  It was very pretty.  I still have it and I wear it often.
segments.speaker: F

segments.text: You went out of your way to torture me over Peter Burden.
segments.speaker: M

segments.text: I did not.  You made the whole thing up in your jealous imagination.
segments.speaker: F

segments.text: You must admit that he was in love with you, wasn't he?
segments.speaker: M

segments.text: Just a little, perhaps, nothing serious.
segments.speaker: F

segments.text: Line?
segments.speaker: M

segments.text: Let him kiss you.
segments.speaker: F

segments.text: You let him kiss you.  You said you did.
segments.speaker: M

segments.text: What of it?
segments.speaker: F

segments.text: What of it?
segments.speaker: M

segments.text: It gave him a lot of pleasure and it didn't hurt me.
segments.speaker: F

segments.text: What about me?
segments.speaker: M

segments.text: If you hadn't been so nosey, you never would have known a thing about it.
segments.speaker: F

segments.text: That's a nice point of view, I must say.
segments.speaker: M

segments.text: Oh, dear.  I'm bored with this conversation.
segments.speaker: F

segments.text: So am I; bored stiff.
segments.speaker: M

segments.text: You want some brandy?
segments.speaker: M

segments.text: No, thanks.

segments.text: I'll have a little myself, I think.
segments.speaker: M

segments.text: I don't see why you want it.  You've already had two glasses.
segments.speaker: F

segments.text: No particular reason.  Anyhow, they were very small ones.
segments.speaker: M

segments.text: It seems so silly to go on and on and on with such a thing.
segments.speaker: F

segments.text: You can hardly call three liquor glasses in a whole evening going on and on and on.
segments.speaker: M

segments.text: It's become a habit with you.
segments.speaker: F

segments.text: You needn't be so grand just because you don't happen to want any at the moment.
segments.speaker: M

segments.text: Oh, don't be so stupid.
segments.speaker: F

segments.text: Really, Amanda
segments.speaker: M

segments.text: What?
segments.speaker: F

segments.text: Nothing.

segments.text: Going out somewhere, my dear?
segments.speaker: M

segments.text: No, just making myself fascinating for you
segments.speaker: F

segments.text: Oh.  That reply has broken my heart.
segments.speaker: M

segments.text: The woman's job is to allure the man.  Watch me a minute, will you?
segments.speaker: F

segments.text: As a matter of fact, that's perfectly true.
segments.speaker: M

segments.text: Oh, no, it isn't.

segments.text: Oh, be quiet.

segments.speaker: M

segments.text: It's a pity you didn't- It's a pity you didn't have more brandy.
segments.speaker: F

segments.speaker: M

segments.text: It doesn't seem to have worked such wonders with you.

segments.text: Snap.  Oh, snap, snap, snap, like a little adder.

segments.text: I don't care.  Do you understand?  I don't care.  I don't mind if they bark and roll about like hoops.

segments.text: Did you see much of Peter Burden after our divorce?
segments.speaker: M

segments.text: Yes, I did, quite a lot.
segments.speaker: F

segments.text: I suppose you let him kiss you a good deal more then, hmm?
segments.speaker: M

segments.text: Mind your own business.
segments.speaker: F

segments.text: You must have had a riotous time.
segments.speaker: M

segments.text: No restraint at all, very enjoyable.  You never had much anyhow.
segments.speaker: M

segments.text: You're quite insufferable.  I expected it's because you're drunk.

segments.text: I'm not in the least drunk.
segments.speaker: M

segments.text: You always had a weak head.
segments.speaker: F

segments.text: I think I mentioned once before that I've only had three minute liquor glasses of brandy this whole evening.  That's hardly enough to get a child of two drunk.
segments.speaker: M

segments.text: On the contrary, a child of two could get violently drunk on only one glass of brandy.

segments.text: Very interesting.  And how about a child of four and a child of six and a child of nine?

segments.text: Oh, shut up.
